title: Effect of size of particles on gas behavior

content.question: The graph above shows how a particular real gas deviates from ideal behavior at very high pressures. Based on this information, which of the following is most likely the gas and gives the reason based on kinetic molecular theory?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has the smallest mass.
<math alttext="N 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its molecules have a triple bond.
<math alttext="N e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has a completely filled valence shell.
<math alttext="S O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has the largest molecular volume.

content.answer: <math alttext="S O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has the largest molecular volume.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
